President Moon should recognize that the problem lies with Kim Jong Un. That is why the U.S.—with full support from South Korea—should continue to maintain the maximum pressure campaign against North Korea. Denuclearization through strength and leverage is the only option.

The Trump Admin. repeatedly attempted to engage in sustained negotiations that would produce balanced outcomes for both NK and U.S. Each step along the way, the Trump Admin. prioritized working with our allies to pursue the denuclearization of North Korea.
Since then, North Korea has not tested a long-range ballistic missile or a nuclear device. Hardly “beating around the bush.”
The Trump Admin.’s bold diplomacy produced the first leader-level commitment from North Korea to denuclearize. Direct engagement led to U.S. detainees returning home from North Korea.

The Trump Admin. inherited an unchecked North Korea nuclear problem, as a result of the failed Obama policy of “strategic patience.” Shortly following my arriving in Japan as U.S. Ambassador, NK launched two ICBMs and detonated a thermonuclear device. https://www.politico.com/news/2021/04/21/south-korean-president-trump-north-korea-diplomacy-483930

I’ve said it before, and I’ll say it again: we must #BuildTheWall.

We need all who believe in a multiracial democracy, and are ready to move forward together in love, to become a part of our movement.

Join us. Help us build a better world.

We are in this moment because of you. Because of organizers across the country demanding progressive change.

But we can’t stop, and we won’t stop, until we are all truly free to thrive and make the world a better place. One in which all of us can thrive together.

America needs a process of truth and collective healing. We must pass HR 40, championed by the late John Conyers and the relentless Sheila Jackson Lee.

Let’s study the need to repair the harms of our history. Only then, will we all be truly free.

We must have honest conversations about race and racism in this country.

It’s not just police violence. It’s housing discrimination, and wage theft, and Black maternal mortality, it’s environmental injustice, and all of the ways racism is built into the very fabric of America.

I have one message to law enforcement, stop killing us! I need for President Joe Biden to say the same thing.

Black people are not for target practice. We are simply trying to survive in a world stacked against us.

I am connected to every Black man in America. Like them my ancestors were kidnapped from Africa, robbed of their language, and stripped of their religion and culture and God, and we continue to be redlined and killed by the police.

Now is the time to address the burning crisis of structural racism in our country.

Every single time I have to watch a video of a Black man, or a Brown kid, die at the hands of police violence, a little piece of me dies too.

The proposals that President Biden has put forward over the last few weeks would represent important steps — but don’t go as big as we’d truly need in order to solve the crises of jobs, climate and care. We need to think bigger.

We must center care as the rebirth of our nation. Because caring is the entire point of what our economy should do.

It should be about caring for each other, not just extracting profits from working people for Wall Street.

In fact, there is a whole economy of workers, mostly women, and disproportionately women of color, who are doing the hard, essential work of caring for our moms and dads, looking after our kids, and healing the sick.

These workers represent the care economy.

If this pandemic has shown us anything, it’s that the American worker is the backbone of this country. It might not be a popular idea around Washington, but the rest of us know that grocery store workers, nurses, teachers, and transit workers are our most essential workers.

We also badly need a $15 minimum wage, not phased in 10 years from now, but today.

And if we need to get rid of the filibuster to do that, that’s absolutely what we need to do.

And we have to build up labor unions too.

That’s why Congress must pass the PRO Act, to do away with so-called “right to work laws,” make it easier for workers to unionize, and even let independent contractors bargain collectively.

We need a Green New Deal for Cities, as my friend Cori Bush has proposed. And we need a Green New Deal for Public Schools.

Every part of our society must become part of the answer, because this crisis is urgent.

We need a Green New Deal for Public Housing, as my colleague and friend Congresswoman Ocasio-Cortez has proposed.

We can repair and transform run-down, neglected apartments in New York and neighborhoods all across America.

It is possible to meet the climate crisis with a big, visionary investment in jobs. Jobs that begin in our most neglected and redlined communities. We must build a Civilian Climate Corps to do the good work of transforming our energy system and our society.

Our movement is Latino, we are Asian, we are Black, we are White, we are a beautiful mix of ethnicities and cultures all over the globe who are demanding justice and humanity.

We are a continuation of the civil rights movement.
It’s on us, as Democrats and progressives, to meet the gravity of the moment. And history will judge our actions.

Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet, and I’m working to ensure every parent and caregiver has the resources to access the Child Tax Credit. File your taxes as soon as possible to ensure that your monthly CTC check makes it to you. https://www.irs.gov/filing/free-file-do-your-federal-taxes-for-free

For families wondering if they’ll be eligible for the Child Tax Credit for a baby born or adopted later this year, the answer is YES—the #AmericanRescuePlan includes a provision allowing new parents to receive the payment as a lump sum when filing their taxes next year.
The Child Tax Credit applies to your 2021 tax year, but the IRS will advance part of the credit in form of checks delivered or direct deposited as early as July, continuing through December.

How it works: If you earn <$75k or your household earns <$150k, you’ll receive $3,600 for each child under age 6 and $3,000 tax for each child age 7-17.
 
If your income exceeds that, the credit will be reduced by $50 for every additional $1k of income. https://www.cnet.com/personal-finance/child-tax-credit-expansion-heres-how-much-money-youll-get-for-each-kid/

87% of children in #AZ09—more than 146,000 kids—will benefit from monthly #ChildTaxCredit payments thanks to the #AmericanRescuePlan.

Tonight, President Biden again showed that the Biden-Harris White House believes in government that fights for all families & working people, not just a few at the top. I look forward to continuing to partner on this work, & expanding opportunity for Minnesotans & all Americans.

In addition to childcare and early education, President Biden touched on the progress we’ve made when it comes to combating the coronavirus pandemic, and the progress we still need to make on police reform, gun safety, and tackling climate change.

I’ve heard from many Minnesotans about the need for affordable, high-quality childcare bc we know early ed is fundamental for families & our economy. So I’m glad President Biden unveiled his American Families Plan & spoke tonight about how it would make investments we badly need.
Hearing Chad’s story and the experiences in Minnesota inspired me to tackle this and work with partners in congress to deliver historic funding to help stabilize this essential sector.

Chad & I connected in the early days of the pandemic about the crisis MN childcare providers & families were facing. Childcare faced huge challenges before the pandemic, but was pushed to the brink and in some cases over the edge.
New Horizon Academy is one of the many childcare providers that the American Rescue Plan will help. While I wish Chad could have been here in-person, it was an honor for him to be my guest.

I want to thank Chad Dunkley for being my virtual guest at President Biden’s Joint Address to Congress tonight. Chad serves as CEO of New Horizon Academy, a family-owned company in Minnesota that has been serving young kids for 50 years.
Parents, kids, our communities and providers like Chad deserve nothing less.

Tonight, I'm looking forward to hearing @POTUS talk more about his plans in the #AmericanFamiliesPlan, and I am so glad that childcare and early education are getting the top-billing these issues deserve.
But there is still much more to be done to make the big, structural investments we need to provide affordable, quality, care for kids and families.
The bulk of that came from the #AmericanRescuePlan, where we worked together to get $39 billion to stabilize childcare after the hit it took with the pandemic.
I've been proud to work with incredible partners in Congress @PattyMurray and @SenWarren to help deliver historic funding to help stabilize this essential sector with more than $50 billion.

As parents know, childcare faced huge challenges before the pandemic. But with COVID it was pushed to the brink and in some cases over the edge. Hearing from childcare providers in Minnesota inspired me to tackle this issue head on.
I'll never forget the emotion in his voice as he shared his story, what was happening to the childcare centers he runs and providers across Minnesota (as revenue plummeted virtually overnight).

It's great to see President Biden unveil his American Families Plan today.
 
My guest tonight Chad Dunkley and I connected in the early days of the pandemic, on March 19 the first week of remote work, about the crisis childcare providers and families were facing.
This speech is a bfd.

President Biden, the House passed the PRO Act. We passed a $15 minimum wage. How we gon get these to your desk without abolishing the Jim Crow filibuster?

I’m grateful to the organizers who delivered the presidency back to the people so that tonight, we don’t have to listen to a twice-impeached white supremacist-in-chief pushing a white supremacist agenda.

The House has already passed multiple bills that would help stop mass shootings and gun violence in our communities. 

All the Senate has to do to save lives is eliminate the filibuster and pass them.

It’s never been a good bet to bet against America. 

And it still isn’t. 
 #JointAddress
We have stared into an abyss of insurrection and autocracy — of pandemic and pain — and “We the People” did not flinch.  #JointAddress

And if we do, then we will meet the central challenge of the age by proving that democracy is durable and strong. 

The autocrats will not win the future. 

America will.  #JointAddress
We’re vaccinating the nation. We’re creating hundreds of thousands of jobs. We’re delivering real results people can see and feel in their own lives.   #JointAddress
Can our democracy deliver on its promise that all of us – created equal in the image of God – have a chance to lead lives of dignity, respect, and possibility?  #JointAddress

And if we are to truly restore the soul of America – we need to protect the sacred right to vote. 

More people voted in the last presidential election than ever before  
in our history – in the middle of one of the worst pandemics ever.  
 #JointAddress
Immigrants have done so much for America during the pandemic – as they have throughout our history.  #JointAddress

Talk to most responsible gun owners, most hunters – they’ll tell you there’s no possible justification for having 100 rounds – 100 bullets – in a weapon. 
 #JointAddress

In the 1990s, we passed universal background checks and a ban on assault weapons and high—capacity magazines that hold 100 rounds that can be fired in seconds. 

We beat the NRA. Mass shootings and gun violence declined. 
 #JointAddress

And I need not tell anyone this, but gun violence is an epidemic in America.  
#JointAddress

It’s estimated that more than 50 women are shot and killed by an intimate partner – every month in America. 

Pass it and save lives.  #JointAddress

Let’s reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act, which has been law in this country for 27 years since I first wrote it. 

It will close the so—called “boyfriend” loophole to keep guns out of the hands of abusers. 
#JointAddress

Most men and women in uniform wear their badge and serve their communities honorably. 

I know them. I know they want to help meet this moment as well.  #JointAddress

And my fellow Americans, we must come together to heal the soul of this nation.  
#JointAddress

We went to Afghanistan to get the terrorists who attacked us on 9/11.  

We delivered justice to Osama Bin Laden and we degraded the terrorist threat of al Qaeda in Afghanistan. 

After 20 years of American valor and sacrifice, it’s time to bring our troops home. 
#JointAddress

America is an idea – unique in the world. 

We are all created equal. It’s who we are. We cannot walk away from that principle. 
 #JointAddress

America will stand up to unfair trade practices that undercut American workers and industries, like subsidies for state-owned enterprises and the theft of American technologies and intellectual property.  #JointAddress

The investments I’ve proposed tonight also advance a foreign policy that benefits the middle class. 

That means making sure every nation plays by the same rules in the global economy, including China.  #JointAddress

--from China and Russia to India and the European Union in my first 100 days. 

I wanted the world to see that there is consensus that we are at an inflection point in history.  #JointAddress

That’s why – I kept my commitment to rejoin the Paris Climate Agreement on my first day in office.  

And I kept my commitment to convene a climate summit right here in America, with all of the major economies of the world –
There’s no wall high enough to keep any virus away.   #JointAddress

My fellow Americans, we have to show not just that we are back, but that we are here to stay. 

And that we aren’t going it alone – we’re going to be leading with our allies.  #JointAddress

My fellow Americans, trickle-down economics has  
never worked. 

It’s time to grow the economy from the bottom up and middle-out.  #JointAddress

20 million Americans lost their jobs in the pandemic – working- and middle-class Americans. 

At the same time, the roughly 650 Billionaires in America saw their net worth increase by more than $1 Trillion.   #JointAddress

According to one study, CEOs make 320 times what their average workers make. 

The pandemic has only made things worse.

Instead of using the tax savings to raise wages and invest in research and development – it poured billions of dollars into the pockets of CEOs.  

In fact, the pay gap between CEOs and their workers is now among the largest in history.

Look at the big tax cut in 2017. 

It was supposed to pay for itself and generate vast economic growth.  

Instead it added $2 trillion to the deficit. 

It was a huge windfall for corporate America and those at the very top.
When you hear someone say that they don’t want to raise taxes on the wealthiest 1% and on corporate America – ask them: whose taxes are you going to raise instead, and whose are you going to cut?
It raises the revenue to pay for the plans I’ve proposed that will create millions of jobs and grow the economy. #JointAddress

But I will not add to the tax burden of the middle class of this country.  

They’re already paying enough. 

What I’ve proposed is fair. It’s fiscally responsible.   #JointAddress

We’re going to get rid of the loopholes that allow Americans who make more than $1 million a year pay a lower rate on their capital gains than working Americans pay on their work.  

This will only affect three tenths of 1% of all Americans.  #JointAddress
And, we’re going to reward work, not wealth.   #JointAddress

A lot of companies evade taxes through tax havens from Switzerland to Bermuda to the Cayman Islands. 

And they benefit from tax loopholes and deductions that allow for offshoring jobs and shifting profits overseas.  #JointAddress

A recent study shows that 55 of the nation’s biggest corporations paid zero in federal income tax last year. 

No federal taxes on more than $40 billion in profits.  #JointAddress

It’s time for corporate America and the wealthiest 1% of Americans to pay their fair share. 

Just pay their fair share. 
 #JointAddress

Let’s start with what I will not do. 

I will not impose any tax increases on people making less than $400,000 a year.  
 #JointAddress

Let’s give Medicare the power to save hundreds of billions of dollars by negotiating lower prices for prescription drugs.  

That won’t just help people on Medicare – it will lower prescription drug costs for everyone.   #JointAddress
The Affordable Care Act has been a lifeline for millions of Americans –protecting people with pre-existing conditions, protecting women’s health.   #JointAddress

In March we expanded a tax credit for every child in a family. 

Up to a $3,000 Child Tax Credit for children over 6 — and $3,600 for children under 6.  

With two parents, two kids, that’s up to $7,200 in your pocket to help take care of your family.  #JointAddress

Third, the American Families Plan will finally provide up to 12 weeks of paid family and medical leave. 

No one should have to choose between a job and paycheck or taking care of themselves and a loved one – a parent, spouse, or child.  #JointAddress
But, the rest of the world isn’t waiting for us. Doing nothing is not an option.  #JointAddress
“Wall Street didn’t build this country. The middle class built this country. And unions built the middle class.” #JointAddress
“The Americans Jobs Plan is a blue-collar blueprint to build America.” #JointAddress
Nearly 90% of the infrastructure jobs created in the American Jobs Plan don’t require a college degree. 75% don’t require an associate’s degree. #JointAddress

Independent experts estimate the American Jobs Plan will add millions of jobs and trillions of dollars in economic growth for years to come. These are good-paying jobs that can’t be outsourced.  #JointAddress
And all the investments in American jobs right now--we got them all on one principle #BuyAmerican  #JointAddress

RT @POTUS Tonight, I can say because of you — the American people — our progress these past 100 days against one of the worst pandemics in history is one of the greatest logistical achievements our country has ever seen.

American jobs plan will help millions of people get back to their jobs and back to their careers
#JointAddress
Public investment in infrastructure has literally transformed America. Our attitudes as well as our opportunities.   #JointAddress
More jobs in the first 100 days than any President on record. #JointAddress
We're on track to cut childhood poverty in half this year. #JointAddress

We’re vaccinating the nation. We’re creating hundreds of thousands of jobs. We’re delivering real results people can see and feel in their own lives. Opening the doors of opportunity. Guaranteeing fairness and justice. #JointAddress

We're working, again.
Dreaming again.
Discovering again.
And, leading the world again.
#JointAddress
Now—after just 100 days—I can report to the nation: America is on the move again. Turning peril into possibility. Crisis into opportunity. Setback into strength.
